newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Marks & Spencer opens two Korean stores.
newsitem.headline: Marks & Spencer opens two Korean stores.

text.p: Marks & Spencer Plc said on Friday it has opened two stores in South Korea, bringing its presence in the Asia Pacific Region to seven countries.
The retailer opened a 25,000 square feet store in Myung-dong, Seoul, on Friday after a smaller store in the same city started operation on March 28, it said in a statement.
Marks & Spencer said the new stores were run as franchises by its Korean partner, a Dae Sung Group affliate, D&S Ltd.
Its wholly-owned and franchise stores operating in the region grew to 36 following the two openings, it added.
